meanings.definition: To stop short and refuse to proceed.
meanings.sent1: The horse kept balking at the jump, causing the rider to fall off.
meanings.sent2: The child was balking at eating his vegetables at dinner.
meanings.sent3: The cat was balking at the idea of taking a bath, meowing loudly in protest.
meanings.sent4: Her fear of failure was balking her progress, like a heavy weight on her shoulders.
meanings.sent5: The car engine was balking, sputtering and refusing to start.

meanings.definition: To hesitate or be unwilling to accept an idea or request.
meanings.sent1: She was balking at the thought of giving a speech in front of a large audience.
meanings.sent2: The dog was balking at going outside in the rain.
meanings.sent3: The student was balking at the teacher's suggestion to redo the assignment.
meanings.sent4: His pride was balking at the idea of asking for help, even though he needed it.
meanings.sent5: The team was balking at the coach's decision, unsure if it was the right move.
